searchDocs.title: Templates
searchDocs.content: Templates This page contains the templates you need for Igneous viewmodels and modpacks.

searchDocs.title: Firemode​
searchDocs.content: </> type Firemode = "Semi" | "Auto" | "Burst" Represents the three hardcoded weapon firemodes

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Igneous.new( name: string, viewmodel: Model -- Refer to the templates page to see an example viewmodel ) → IgneousWeapon Creates a new weapon

searchDocs.title: What is Igneous?​
searchDocs.content: Igneous is a lightweight, modular FPS framework for Roblox providing core weapon mechanics with a hook-based modpack system. You can create FPS games super easily, by dropping in premade modpacks.  Here are some quick links to get started with Motus:  APIInstallation guide

searchDocs.title: OnEquip​
searchDocs.content: </> Modpack.OnEquip(weapon: IgneousWeapon) → () Called when a weapon is equipped by the player.

searchDocs.title: OnUnequip​
searchDocs.content: </> Modpack.OnUnequip(weapon: IgneousWeapon) → () Called when a weapon is unequipped by the player.

searchDocs.title: OnFireStart​
searchDocs.content: </> Modpack.OnFireStart(weapon: IgneousWeapon) → () Called when the player starts firing (mouse down/trigger pressed).

searchDocs.title: OnFire​
searchDocs.content: </> Modpack.OnFire( weapon: IgneousWeapon, origin: { position: Vector3 , direction: Vector3 },-- The origin of the projectile result: RaycastResult?-- Hit result if the raycast struck something, nil otherwise ) → () Called each time a projectile is fired.

searchDocs.title: OnFireEnd​
searchDocs.content: </> Modpack.OnFireEnd(weapon: IgneousWeapon) → () Called when the player stops firing (mouse down/trigger released).

searchDocs.title: OnAmmoChange​
searchDocs.content: </> Modpack.OnAmmoChange( weapon: IgneousWeapon, previous: number,-- The previous ammo count current: number,-- The new ammo count reason: "reload" | "fired" | "set"-- Why the ammo changed ) → () Called whenever the weapon's ammo count changes.

searchDocs.title: Method 1 - Package Manager (Wally)​
searchDocs.content: Using Wally, just add igneous = "notkaif/igneous@2.0.0" to your wally.toml Then run   wally install   in the command line!  Need the exported Luau types?Using wally-package-types run  wally-package-types --sourcemap sourcemap.json Packages/

searchDocs.title: Method 2 - Manual​
searchDocs.content: Visit the latest releaseUnder Assets, find the .rbxm file and import it into Studio` Note: This does not automatically update

searchDocs.title: Name​
searchDocs.content: </> IgneousWeapon.Name: string The name of the weapon

searchDocs.title: Viewmodel​
searchDocs.content: </> IgneousWeapon.Viewmodel: Model  The cloned viewmodel instance for this weapon

searchDocs.title: Animator​
searchDocs.content: </> IgneousWeapon.Animator: MotusAnimator The Motus animator for controlling weapon animations. See the specific documentation for usage.

searchDocs.title: Equip​
searchDocs.content: </> IgneousWeapon:Equip() → () Equips the weapon, making it visible and triggering the OnEquip hook for all registered modpacks. The viewmodel is parented to Workspace and becomes active.

searchDocs.title: Unequip​
searchDocs.content: </> IgneousWeapon:Unequip() → () Unequips the weapon, hiding it and triggering the OnUnequip hook for all registered modpacks. The viewmodel is parented back to ReplicatedStorage and becomes inactive.

searchDocs.title: SetFiring​
searchDocs.content: </> IgneousWeapon:SetFiring( firing: boolean-- Whether the weapon should start or stop firing ) → () Controls the weapon's firing state. When set to true, begins firing based on the weapon's firemode (Semi, Burst, or Auto). When set to false, stops firing. Triggers OnFireStart and OnFireEnd hooks accordingly. Only works when the weapon is equipped and has ammunition.

searchDocs.title: Viewmodel Structure
searchDocs.content: Viewmodel Structure An Igneous Viewmodel must contain 3 items to function properly: A Primary Part The viewmodel must be a Model instanceThe primary part is where the viewmodel will bind to the camera An Animator Igneous animates your viewmodels using Motus A data module The data module stores the base/template data for the weapon, for example the ammo data, firemode, etc Here is an example of a data module: -- Viewmodel/Data.luau return { -- REQUIRED CanFire = true, Accuracy = 0.8, Range = 300, MaxSpread = 3, Ammo = 20, MaxAmmo = 20, Reserve = 100, Firemode = "Semi", Cooldown = 0.1, Projectiles = 1, Recoil = { Vertical = 2.1, Horizontal = 0.6 }, AimSpeed = 0.7, CanReloadWhileAiming = false, CanAim = true, -- OPTIONAL (You can add any sort of data that might fit your needs) DisplayName = "Name", Damage = { Torso = 50, Head = 80, Limbs = 20, Armor = 30 }, } Note: Reloading, ammo manipulation and aiming are features that are not currently implemented. It will be added in the future.

searchDocs.title: Modpack Structure
searchDocs.content: Modpack Structure Igneous uses modpacks to extend the functionality of your weapons. Some examples may be a modpack that damages humanoids when a weapon is shot, or something purely visual like muzzle flashes, bullet holes, etc. You can also store store assets inside of your modpack, for example instances, extra modules, etc. Note: Although Igneous modpacks are supposed to be extremely portable, we do not recommend putting your server scripts inside your Modpack. Put your server scripts in ServerScriptService. A template modpack can be found here, or you can see one here: -- References to "Motus" can be removed if you don't animate the viewmodel -- Or if you don't need the autocomplete (Not recommended) local Motus = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.Packages.Motus) local Modpack = {} type Weapon = { Name: string, Viewmodel: Model, Animator: Motus.MotusAnimator, } function Modpack.OnEquip(weapon: Weapon) print(weapon.Name, "has been equipped") end function Modpack.OnUnequip(weapon: Weapon) print(weapon.Name, "has been unequipped") end function Modpack.OnFireStart(weapon: Weapon) print(weapon.Name, "has started firing") end function Modpack.OnFireEnd(weapon: Weapon) print(weapon.Name, "has stopped firing") end function Modpack.OnFire(weapon: Weapon, origin: { position: vector, direction: vector }, result: RaycastResult?) print(weapon.Name, "has fired at", origin) if result then print("..." .. "and has hit the part", result.Instance.Name, "at", result.Position) end end function Modpack.OnAmmoChange(weapon: Weapon, previous: number, current: number, reason: "reload" | "fired" | "set") print(weapon.Name, "has changed from", previous("bullets to"), current, "because a", reason, "happened") end return Modpack
